snippet: Six years after the last change, taxi rides will cost 17 percent more on average, with fares for the longest trips going up the most.
abstract: New York City's Taxi and Limousine Commission says that operators of yellow taxis may now put higher fares, which increased by about 17 percent, into effect once they have recalibrated their meters and updated external markings.
lead_paragraph: Six years after the last change, taxi rides will cost 17 percent more on average, with fares for the longest trips going up the most.

headline.seo: New York Taxis to Start Charging Increased Rates
headline.main: As of Tuesday, Yellow Cabs Can Charge Higher Rates
headline.print_headline: As of Today, Yellow Cabs Can Charge Higher Rates
